revised_title: Exploring the Mechanism of Vision and the Role of the Eye Muscles
tldr: The author, David Hosack, discusses the mechanism of vision and the role of the eye muscles in focusing on objects at different distances. He challenges the idea that the iris and the crystalline lens are solely responsible for this ability and suggests that the external muscles of the eye may also play a role. The author also examines the structure of the crystalline lens and its layers, questioning the existence of muscles within the lens.
